Issue: ChromeClientImpl::windowToScreen utterly broken for resolution independence
Issue description:
ChromeClientImpl::windowToScreen converts from window coordinates to screen
coordinates by just adding on the offset of the window. That wroooong. Both
ChromeClientImpl::screenToWindow and ChromeClientImpl::windowToScreen
should be ripped out, and anyone using them should be passing local
coordinates to the view system, which has the ability to actually do the
correct calculations.

Issue: DRT: blob scheme is not registered
Issue description:
The following blob-related tests do not pass with the Chromium DRT:

fast/files/apply-blob-url-to-img.html
fast/files/apply-blob-url-to-xhr.html
fast/files/read-blob-async.html
http/tests/local/blob/send-data-blob.html
http/tests/local/blob/send-hybrid-blob.html
http/tests/local/blob/send-sliced-data-blob.html
http/tests/local/send-sliced-dragged-file.html
http/tests/local/formdata/send-form-data-with-sliced-file.html

This is because the blob: URL scheme is not registered in the Chromium DRT (only in test_shell)

Issue: Expose WebKit logging to the chrome command line
Issue description:
While debugging Issue 68622, I found I had to recompile to switch webkit logging levels. The API is *almost* there to bring it to the command line, so how about we do that instead?

The API is WebKit::enableLogChannel, perhaps just pass down a list of channels to WebKit::initialize, or call enableLogChannel in RenderTHread::EnsureWebKitInitialized ?

Issue: ChromeFrame foreground popup windows in IE6 don't come into the foreground.
Issue description:
This can be reproduced by logging into gmail with IE6 and then opening
up a conversation window or by popping out a chat window.

The new window at times opens up behind the main IE6 window which makes such sites unusable at times.

Issue: about:gpu reports accelerated canvas acceleration even though its off
Issue description:
Chrome Version : 16.0.912.0
OS Version: OS X 10.6.8
URLs (if applicable) :
Other browsers tested:
Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue:
Safari 5:
Firefox 4.x:
IE 7/8/9:

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. go to about:gpu
2. Accelerated canvas is reported as on

It seems that we have this type of bug every time we tweak accelerated rendering. The core issue is that the people doing the change of behavior aren't paying attention to about:gpu, and vice versa.

Is there a way we can make this less fragile while also fixing the issue?

Issue: Be more aggressive with errors caused by missing files in the disk cache.
Issue description:
It looks like some crappy third party apps attempt to delete cache files under chrome without doing a very good job.

So far, we treat file IO errors as "soft", because they may go away next time (may be an AV temporarily preventing an operation, for instance). We should really doom entries as soon as we see something that doesn't add up (like when we cannot open a file to read the data), so at least next time we'll have to fetch content from the net instead of failing again.

Issue: Potential XSS attack with [0x8E][0xE3] in EUC-JP page
Issue description:
VULNERABILITY DETAILS
Google Chrome treats [0x8E][0xEC] as [0x5C] in EUC-JP page.
This means that even though the developer takes correct XSS protection, XSS occurs.

Ex:

http://example.com/?q=xxx%22%3C%3E --------

<script>var x="xxx\"<>"</script>

-----------------------------------------------

http://example.com/?q=%8E%EC%22;alert(1)// --------

<script>var x="[0x8E][0xEC]\";alert(1)//"</script>

------------------------------------------------

VERSION
Chrome Version: 16.0.912.75 stable
Operating System: Windows Vista sp2

Issue: A 'change' event does not fire when a mouse drag occurs to switch elements in a listbox <select>
Issue description:
Chrome Version : 17.0.963.33
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
URLs (if applicable) :
Other browsers tested:
Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue:
Safari 5: ?
Firefox 4.x: OK
IE 7/8/9: OK

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Click an item in a select list and the onchange event fires as expected.
2. Click and item and hold the mouse button down and drag to another element (causing the selected item to change). The onchange event does not fire.

What is the expected result?
The onchange event should fire.

What happens instead?
Nothing

Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

UserAgentString: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/535.11 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/17.0.963.33 Safari/535.11

See the attached HTML file as an example. Notice as you select an item in the list and drag your mouse to another item (say red to blue), the onchange event is not fired. The reason this can be a problem is depending on how a user operates the mouse, a "drag" selection may accidentally occur.

I have only noticed this problem in the latest Chrome betas. It is very apparent in our main web application which uses select lists and the onchange event to trigger a postback (ASP.NET and autopostback) to cause the page to refresh with new content. Often when selecting a new element on a list, the event does not fire, causing confusion and problems within our application. The frustrating thing is that 9 out of 10 times the event will fire when making a simple selection. The drag behavior outlined above is the only case where it seemed to be reproducible every time. I am guessing this is may be what is causing the selection problems we are experiencing in our application.

Issue: Two sided' (duplex) option disappears with Ricoh MPC3501
Issue description:
Mac 10.6.8
Chrome: 19.0.1036.7 and 18.0.1025.7

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Bring up print preview for a webpage
2. Select Ricoh MPC3501 (which has duplex)

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
- Expect Two-sided option to appear
- Instead no two-sided option appears until I select a different (duplex) printer, HP LaserJet 9050dn, which shows the two-sided option correctly, then switch back to the Ricoh.
- Issue will reproduce if I print to Google Cloud Print and then print preview again. Otherwise the two-sided option persists as expected.

Issue: Gamepad analog stick values out of bounds
Issue description:
Chrome Version : Google Chrome 19.0.1078.0 (Official Build 128404) canary
URLs (if applicable) :
Other browsers tested:
Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue:
Safari 5:
Firefox 4.x:
IE 7/8/9:

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Load the attached gamepad.html example page in Chrome canary for Windows.
2. Attach an XInput-based gamepad and move one of the sticks to the far left/bottom.
3. Note that the axis value for that stick/direction can exceed 1, or become lower than -1.

What is the expected result?
According to https://dvcs.w3.org/hg/gamepad/raw-file/default/gamepad.html#gamepad-interface gamepad axis values must be in the range of [-1, 1]

What happens instead?
When an analog stick is moved to the far left or bottom, the value can escape this range.

Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if
possible.

The reason seems to be that the XInput API on Windows uses the range [-32768, 32767] for an analog stick, and Chrome (Webkit?) converts it incorrectly by dividing it by 32767. Since -32768 / 32767 < -1, an erroneous reading is given by the gamepad js api. Correct conversion should, eg axis x:
x' = ((x + 32768.0) / 32767.5) - 1

Issue: Can't add GMail app to Chrome
Issue description:

Package is invalid. Details: '/tmp/scope_dir_STByHY/CRX_INSTALL/_locales/zh_TH/messages.json: Line: 1, colmn: 1, Root value must be an array or obkect.'.

This also prevented Gmail which is a standard app to be installed by default on my test chrome user.

1. launch chrome with new profile
2. sign into sync via NTP sync promo, for a profile that has a lot of apps synced.
3. look at ntp

expected -- I see all my apps
actual -- I see just a few apps, and the console is spammed by countless error messages. (see below)

Issue: IndexedDB: Implement IDBRequest.error (readonly attribute of type DOMError)
Issue description:
From ye olde spec:

http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/IndexedDB/raw-file/tip/Overview.html#request-api

error of type DOMError, readonly
When the done flag is true, getting this property must return the error of the request. This is null when no error occurred. When the done flag is false, getting this property must throw a DOMException of type InvalidStateError.


Currently, the WebKit IDL has: 

readonly attribute unsigned short errorCode

Issue: CSS3 transform3d + overflow:hidden crashes the GPU
Issue description:
I ran into a bug of the Chrome's GPU in the version 19.0.1084

Unfortunately, I believe the Chrome GPU is geting worse every new version, especially when using hardware acceleration.

Chrome Version : 19.0.1084.46
OS Version: OS X 10.6.8
URLs (if applicable) :

Safari 5:
Firefox 4.x:
IE 7/8/9:

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Apply CSS 3D transformation such as translate3d or rotate3d
2. Apply overflow:hidden
3. The result is attached.

What is the expected result?

All the elements are mixed up. So many problems repainting elements.

What happens instead?

The elements should be repainted correctly when changing the values of translate3d, rotate3d, and so on.


Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if
possible.

Issue: Chrome causes 100% CPU when connecting via Secure Websockets
Issue description:
Chrome Version : OS Version: 5.1 (Windows XP Pro SP3 32 Bit); 6.1 (Windows 7 32/64 Bit)
URLs (if applicable) :
Other browsers tested: Chrome 19, 20 beta, 21 (dev)
Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue:
Chrome 18: OK <==== !!!
Safari 5: OK
Firefox 4.x: OK
IE 7/8/9: N/A

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Used test project from via .NET implementations of Websockets, specifically SuperWebSockets (OpenSource implementation found here: http://superwebsocket.codeplex.com/)

What is the expected result?
The browser should connect right away to wss://localhost:8089/ while server application is listening on the same machine on port 8089 with a self signed SSL.

What happens instead?
The Chrome's process jumps to 100% CPU for aboutu 2-3 mins and then it connects to the server. After it connects, the CPU falls back to 0% and everything is fine at this point.

Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.
NOTE THAT THIS ISSUE *DO NOT* HAPPEN IN CHROME 18, IT JUST STARTED AFTER I UPGRADED TO CHROME 19! I ALSO VERIFIED THAT THIS ISSUE EXISTS IN CHROME 20 BETA AND CHROME 21 DEV.

Issue: Meta tag refresh doesn't work if back navigation script is included
Issue description:
Chrome Version : <Copy from: '19.0.1084.56 m'>
URLs (if applicable) :
Other browsers tested:
Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue:
Safari 5: No
Firefox 4.x: YES
IE 7/8/9: YES

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1.create a meta tag refresh
<meta http-equiv="refresh" content="10; url=http://www.google.com">

2.include <script language="JavaScript">
function noBack(){window.history.forward()}
noBack();
window.onload=noBack;
window.onpageshow=function(evt){if(evt.persisted)noBack()}
window.onunload=function(){void(0)}
</script>
3.Meta tag doesn't redirect to www.google.com after 10 seconds

What is the expected result? should redirect to url 


What happens instead?
Doesn't redirect to url

Full code:

<html> 
<head>
<title>App- Log In</title>

<meta http-equiv="refresh" content="10; url=http://www.google.com">

<script language="JavaScript">
function noBack(){window.history.forward()}
noBack();
window.onload=noBack;
window.onpageshow=function(evt){if(evt.persisted)noBack()}
window.onunload=function(){void(0)}
</script> 

</head>

<body>
Testing
</body>
</html>

Issue: Set up an upstream WebKit Tester-bot
Issue description:
Originally reported in http://b.corp.google.com/6335007

(Posted on April 13 2012 11:48 GMT by peter@chromium.org)

Set up a WebKit tester to run webkit_unit_tests, TestWebKitAPI and layout tests. This bot should be listed on build.webkit.org and pull builds from the current builder.

Issue: clean up SyncSchedulerImpl backoff override logic
Issue description:
https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10826194/ added a mechanism for integration tests to override the long exponential backoff delay.

For one, tests shouldn't include things not in sync/public, but we should also follow convention with config params for the scheduler.

This bug tracks that cleanup work, as well as moving IsError convenience functions to syncer_error.

Issue: APK generation should work for WebKit
Issue description: The inclusion path for our ant configuration files in base/android/ does not take WebKit's different directory structure into account. It should.

Issue: search_provider_overrides doesn't work correctly
Issue description:
Version of Google Chrome (Wrench-> About Google Chrome): Version 22.0.1229.94 m
Version of MSI (if applicable):
Using group policy settings? No

Attempting to change the "default search provider" for new Chrome installation is not working. We have tried adding something like this to master_preferences:

"default_search_provider": {
"enabled": true,
"encodings": "UTF-8",
"icon_url": "http://www.bing.com/s/wlflag.ico",
"id": "4",
"instant_url": "",
"keyword": "bing.com",
"name": "Bing",
"prepopulate_id": "3",
"search_url": "http://www.bing.com/search?setmkt=en-US&q={searchTerms}",
"suggest_url": "http://api.bing.com/osjson.aspx?query={searchTerms}&language={language}"
},

However, the "Preferences" file created at "C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local\Google\Chrome\User Data\Default\" always ends up with the generic values:

"default_search_provider": {
"enabled": true,
"encodings": "UTF-8",
"icon_url": "http://www.google.com/favicon.ico",
"id": "2",
"instant_url": "{google:baseURL}webhp?{google:RLZ}sourceid=chrome-instant&ie={inputEncoding}{google:instantEnabledParameter}{searchTerms}",
"keyword": "google.com",
"name": "Google",
"prepopulate_id": "1",
"search_url": "{google:baseURL}search?q={searchTerms}&{google:RLZ}{google:acceptedSuggestion}{google:originalQueryForSuggestion}{google:assistedQueryStats}{google:searchFieldtrialParameter}sourceid=chrome&ie={inputEncoding}",
"suggest_url": "{google:baseSuggestURL}search?{google:searchFieldtrialParameter}client=chrome&hl={language}&q={searchTerms}"
},

We have also tried this approach as suggested in another issue:

"search_provider_overrides": [ {
"encoding": "UTF-8",
"favicon_url": "http://www.foo.com/favicon.ico",
"id": "1001",
"keyword": "firstkey",
"name": "first",
"search_url": "http://www.foo.com/s?q={searchTerms}",
"suggest_url": "http://www.foo.com/s?q={searchTerms}"
}, {
"encoding": "UTF-8",
"favicon_url": "http://www.bar.com/favicon.ico",
"id": "1002",
"keyword": "secondkey",
"name": "second",
"search_url": "http://www.bar.com/s?q={searchTerms}",
"suggest_url": "http://www.bar.com/s?q={searchTerms}"
}, {
"encoding": "UTF-8",
"favicon_url": "http://www.baz.com/favicon.ico",
"id": "1003",
"keyword": "thirdkey",
"name": "third",
"search_url": "http://www.baz.com/s?q={searchTerms}",
"suggest_url": "http://www.baz.com/s?q={searchTerms}"
} ],
"search_provider_overrides_version": 1,

These settings are properly copied to new user Preferences but do not seem to have any effect on the user search experience.

Issue: Resource Timing entries include dataURIs
Issue description:
Chrome Version : 25.0.1358.0 (172434)
URLs (if applicable) : See attached test case
Other browsers tested:
IE 10: OK

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Open attached file
2. Inspect list of resource via window.performance.webkitGetEntriesByType("resource")

What is the expected result?

dataURI should not be included in list of resources as per Resource Timing spec

"If an HTML IMG element has a data: URI as its source, then this resource will not be included as a PerformanceResourceTiming object in the Performance Timeline. By definition data: URI contains embedded data and does not require access to the networking layer."

What happens instead?

dataURI is included in list of requests

Issue: Consider replacing the CrApplication event hook hackery with real event hooks
Issue description:
We have an NSApplication subclass mostly for adding event hooks, which are used in a few places (bookmarks menus, popup menus) to intercept a few event types.

Starting with 10.6, AppKit supports this directly:

https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Cocoa/Reference/ApplicationKit/Classes/NSEvent_Class/Reference/Reference.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/20000016-SW205

It'd be nice if we could get rid of our subclass. (It leads to duplicate class warnings in tests, etc)

Issue: A download with a forced path doesn't need an intermediate path
Issue description:
Starting a download with a forced path (e.g.: /path/foo.txt) results in:
- Create the temporary file at /path/foo.txt
- Renaming to intermediate path /path/foo.txt.crdownload
- Renaming to filename path /path/foo.txt

We should get rid of the intermediate path.

Issue: chrome debug build crashes when use geolocation in local pages
Issue description: When chrome is launched with --disable-web-security and a local page trys to use the geolocation api, the chrome browser will ask permssion from user and then will update geolocation permission for the local page with URL file:///. But the file:/// is not a valid ContentSettingsPattern. It will cause crash in debug build.

Issue: wrong keyLocation property set for keypress events
Issue description:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.17 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/24.0.1312.56 Safari/537.17

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. attach a 'keypress' event listener to a page that prints out the events keyLocation property
2. Hit the '.' key (not the one on the numpad)
3. Try to hit other keys from the 'central' part of the keyboard. Some will give you '3', some will give '0'.

(or test it here http://jsfiddle.net/d266H/1/)

What is the expected behavior?
0 should be displayed for all the keys as they are located in the DOM_KEY_LOCATION_STANDARD part of the keyboard.

What went wrong?
the events have a keyLocation property set to 3, which maps to DOM_KEY_LOCATION_NUMPAD.

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 24.0.1312.56 Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)

As far as i can tell, the keyLocation property is correctly set for the keydown and keyup events but not always for the keypress.

Issue: ui should reflect actual proxy used when it's recommended proxy policy
Issue description:
Chrome OS Version : tot off 9/21/11
Chrome Version : tot off 9/21/11

when there's a non-direct recommended proxy policy and no network proxy, proxy configuration dialog should show the recommended proxy so that user knows what he/she is overwriting before modifying.

pls note that with the current version off tot:
- recommended proxy is already effective if the network has no proxy as reflected at net-internals/#proxy, but proxy ui is not showing it
- proxy configuration dialog does NOT overwrite the recommended proxy if user just opens and closes the dialog without changing anything, as will be reflected by net-internals/#proxy.

the recommended proxy will be across networks, so b4 user modifies proxy of any network, all networks will show the same recommended proxy. when user modifies the recommended proxy for a particular network, it's only for that network.

Chrome Version : 20.0.1129.0

Precondition ::

What steps will reproduce the problem?

Device should enroll successfully.

What do you see instead?
Fail to enroll the device with error message.

Issue: IndexedDB: Database callbacks incorrectly cleaned up
Issue description:
In IndexedDBDispatcher::RequestIDBFactoryOpen, a WebIDBDatabaseCallbacks is added to the pending_database_callbacks_ IDMap, yielding a callback IPC ID.

In IndexedDBDispatcher::RequestIDBDatabaseClose there is an attempt to remove an ID from the map. That ID comes from the RendererWebIDBDatabaseImpl::close() and is the impl's ipc_database_id_ member - but that ID is the database's IPC ID is NOT the callback's IPC ID.

Try the attached openclose.html. It does the following:

* opens a connection - this ends up with callback IPC ID 1 and when complete with database IPC ID 1.
* starts a transaction - this ends up with callback IPC ID 2
* opens a second connection - this ends up with callback IPC ID 3 and database IPC ID 2
* closes the second connection - this removes ID 2 from pending_database_callbacks_. WRONG - should be ID 3.
* lets the transaction complete - this attempts to fire complete but the callback IPC ID 2 is no longer in the table, so oncomplete never fires (!)

Issue: GraphicsContext: Merge platform/graphics and platform/graphics/skia and remove redundant code
Issue description:
Version: Future
OS: All

This is the meta-bug for graphics stack modifications in Blink.

There is currently a lot of extraneous API translating between GraphicsContext and PlatformContextSkia and then Skia. This bug is to remove the cruft.

There are several steps, not all of which might happen:
1. Have GraphicsContext APIs call directly into Skia, removing the need for PLatformContextSkia
2. Modify GraphicsContext APIs to better match Skia and avoid extraneous data conversions.
3. ??

Issue: checkLayout() should error out if no data-expected* attributes were found
Issue description:
Definitely a patch we'll want to pull over into blink. Migrated from WebKit Bugzilla: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=114900 Originally reported 2013-04-20 03:41 PST by Robert Hogan (robert@webkit.org). Description: .. Attachments: 2013-04-20 03:56 PST: Patch [https://bugs.webkit.org/attachment.cgi?id=198938&action=prettypatch] Comments: ================================ Comment #1 Posted on 2013-04-20 03:56:46 PST by Robert Hogan (robert@webkit.org) Created an attachment (id=198938) [https://bugs.webkit.org/attachment.cgi?id=198938] [details] [https://bugs.webkit.org/attachment.cgi?id=198938&action=edit] Patch ================================ Comment #2 Posted on 2013-04-21 10:46:04 PST by Ojan Vafai (ojan@chromium.org) (From update of attachment 198938 [https://bugs.webkit.org/attachment.cgi?id=198938] [details] [https://bugs.webkit.org/attachment.cgi?id=198938&action=edit]) View in context: https://bugs.webkit.org/attachment.cgi?id=198938&action=review This is great. Mostly a bunch of style nits. Only things I'd definitely like to see changed to not output the error to the console as it's just redundant and to include FAIL in the error text. Would be nice if you addressed the nits as well. > LayoutTests/fast/check-layout-error-no-attributes.html:1 > + Nit: standard doctype is > LayoutTests/fast/check-layout-error-no-attributes.html:3 > + Nit: you can just leave the element out. > LayoutTests/fast/check-layout-error-no-attributes.html:11 > +

webkit.org/b/114900: checkLayout() should error out if the layout wasn't checked.

> + xxx yyy > + This indentation is inconsistent. > LayoutTests/resources/check-layout.js:31 > + layout.checked = layout.checked || result; Nit: layout.checked |= result; > LayoutTests/resources/check-layout.js:37 > + var layout = { checked: false }; Nit: Calling this "layout" seems a bit confusing to me. How about..."output"? > LayoutTests/resources/check-layout.js:195 > + checkedLayout = checkExpectedValues(node.parentNode, failures) || checkedLayout; > + checkedLayout = checkSubtreeExpectedValues(node, failures) || checkedLayout; I prefer |= in cases like this. > LayoutTests/resources/check-layout.js:207 > + document.body.innerHTML = "No valid data-* attributes found in selector list : " + selectorList; Please prefix this with "FAIL: " to make it even more clear the test is failing. > LayoutTests/resources/check-layout.js:208 > + console.error("No valid data-* attributes found in :" + selectorList); I don't think the console error add value on top of the innerHTML.

Issue: [CSS Grid Layout] Support grid-definition-{rows|columns} repeat() syntax
Issue description:
The specification allows a grid definition to be repeated by using the repeat() function:

<track-list> => [ [ <string> ]* <track-group> [ <string> ]* ]+ | none
<track-group> => <track-minmax> | [ repeat( <positive-integer> , [ [ <string> ]* <track-minmax> [ <string> ]* ]+ ) ]

Issue: Remove dependencies on FontPlatformDataChromiumWin::hfont()
Issue description:
FontPlatformDataChromiumWin currently exposes the underlying hfont. This makes the underlying implementation leak through the skia abstraction and makes the direct write transition harder.

We should try to remove all direct uses of HFONT in the blink code.

Issue: breakpad_unittests don't build on Android on at breakpad head
Issue description:
https://breakpad.appspot.com/550002/ doesn't build on Android.

Does it make sense to build breakpad_unittests on Android? What about linux_ptrace_dumper_unittest.cc?

Issue: A transition of width: auto to a fixed width computes auto as zero.
Issue description:
Migrated from WebKit Bugzilla: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=16020
Originally reported 2007-11-16 14:25 PST by Timothy Hatcher (timothy@apple.com).
Keywords: InRadar


Description:
A transition of width: auto to a fixed width computes auto as zero. See attached test case.

[http://wkb.ug/46590] NEW - [Meta] Make CSS in WebKit more awesome

Comment #7
Posted on 2009-02-27 10:29:14 PST by Simon Fraser (smfr) (simon.fraser@apple.com)

Comment from Dave Hyatt on the w3-style list:

This is right. In WebKit, we transition on the computed value of a property (not the specified value or used value). Note that there have been requests to transition on the used value instead, the most obvious example being wanting to transition from, e.g., width:100% to width:50px. If you transition on the computed value, then it's impossible to run an animation from width:auto to width:50px or from width:50% to width:80px, etc.

The problem with transitioning on the used value, though, is it can change when your style hasn't.... if you resize a window that contains a width:auto or width:100% block for example. Obviously you don't want to run a transition in that case.

My own preference would be (for simplicity) to just stick with transitioning on the computed value and to just say "Tough" to people who want to animate width this way, but maybe others disagree. We continue to get bugs in WebKit from confused people trying to animate auto widths to fixed values (or percents to fixed values) and not understanding why it doesn't work.

================================

Posted on 2009-11-29 15:03:26 PST by Michael Kozakewich (mkozakewich@icosidodecahedron.com)

Comment #9
Posted on 2010-01-07 14:13:47 PST by Maciej Stachowiak (mjs@apple.com)

How about we animate on the used value but only when the computed value changes?

Comment #10
Posted on 2010-01-07 14:53:11 PST by Faruk Ates (farukates@me.com)

Isn't the computed value internally kept as a pixel value no matter what the unit is? Wouldn't that mean that a change from width:80px to width:auto could do a non-transitioned lookup to see what pixel value "auto" currently computes to, and transition to that?

I'm probably not understanding it, but it seems weird that every Javascript library in the world that does this has it figured out, but a hardware accelerated implementation can't?

================================

Comment #11
Posted on 2010-01-20 08:58:29 PST by Sidney San Martn (s+webkit@sidneysm.com)

> My own preference would be (for simplicity) to just stick with transitioning on
the computed value and to just say "Tough" to people who want to animate width
this way, but maybe others disagree.

Many use cases for CSS transitions and animations include starting and ending at a computed value  showing and hiding content is a huge one.

Also, treating computed values as zero is never going to be the right behavior. If this isn't going to be fixed, then trying to animate a computed property should kill the animation entirely.

================================

Comment #12
Posted on 2010-01-20 09:45:47 PST by Faruk Ates (farukates@me.com)

I think not fixing this bug would be a grave mistake; this is the #1 use case for animation libraries used on the Web today, and thus, the #1 use case for the CSS Transitions implementation. And it is broken in CSS Transitions.

================================

Issue: Play button in audio/video control remains highlighted
Issue description:

OS: <Linux Ubuntu 12.04>

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1.Open the link http://www.russianlessons.net/audio/audio-test.php.
2.Now click on play option of any of the audio test. 
3.Go to any other tab and then come back to the previous tab(audio-test). 

What is the expected output? 
The play option should not remain highlighted.

What do you see instead?
The play option remains highlighted.

Issue: Fire all-null 'ondevicemotion' events only once.
Issue description:
According to the specification http://dev.w3.org/geo/api/spec-source-orientation.html if a device cannot provide any motion information (e.g. neither accelerometer nor gyroscope) an all-null event should be fired.

The firing of the all-null event should happen only once to save battery and cpu resources. The specification is being amended to include this requirement explicitly.

Issue: WebIDL's "long" should map to "int32" in C++
Issue description:
WebIDL defines |long| as being a 32 bit unsigned value.

However in C++, "long" is a 64-bit value.

There is widespread confusion throughout the Blink code between the *.idl files and *.h:

* using "long" instead of "int"
* using "long long" instead of "long"
* using "unsigned long" instead of "unsigned"
* using "unsigned long long" instead of "unsigned long"

At best this is a waste of memory. At worst, the narrowing from an 8-byte number to a 4-byte number is causing subtle problems.

Here is a non-exhaustive survey I did of the code that has this problem:

* Source/core/xml/XMLHttpRequest.idl vs Source/core/xml/XMLHttpRequest.h (timeout)

* Source/core/xml/XPathResult.idl vs Source/core/xml/XPathResult.h (snapshotLength)

* Source/modules/speech/SpeechSynthesisEvent.idl vs Source/modules/speech/SpeechSynthesisEvent.h (charIndex)

* Source/modules/speech/SpeechRecognitionResultList.idl vs Source/modules/speech/SpeechRecognitionResultList.h (length)

* Source/modules/speech/SpeechRecognitionResult.idl vs Source/modules/speech/SpeechRecognitionResult.h (length)

* Source/modules/speech/SpeechGrammarList.idl vs Source/modules/speech/SpeechGrammarList.h (length)

* Source/modules/speech/SpeechRecognition.idl vs Source/modules/speech/SpeechRecognition.h (maxAlternatives)

* Source/modules/indexeddb/IDBCursor.idl vs Source/modules/indexeddb/IDBCursor.h (advance)

* Source/modules/indexeddb/IDBFactory.idl vs Source/modules/indexeddb/IDBFactory.h (open)

* Source/modules/websockets/WebSocket.idl vs Source/modules/websockets/WebSocket.h (bufferedAmount)

* Source/modules/webaudio/AudioDestinationNode.idl vs ource/modules/webaudio/AudioDestinationNode.h (maxChannelCount)

* Source/modules/webaudio/AudioContext.idl vs Source/modules/webaudio/AudioContext.h (activeSourceCount)

* Source/modules/gamepad/Gamepad.idl vs Source/modules/gamepad/Gamepad.h (timestamp)

* Source/modules/mediastream/RTCDataChannel.idl vs Source/modules/mediastream/RTCDataChannel.h (bufferedAmount)

* Source/modules/webdatabase/WorkerGlobalScopeWebDatabase.idl vs Source/modules/webdatabase/WorkerGlobalScopeWebDatabase.h (estimatedSize)

* Source/modules/mediasource/SourceBufferList.idl vs Source/modules/mediasource/SourceBufferList.h (length)

* Source/core/html/track/TextTrackRegion.idl vs ource/core/html/track/TextTrackRegion.h (height)

* Source/modules/filesystem/FileWriterSync.idl vs Source/modules/filesystem/FileWriterSync.h (seek)

* Source/modules/mediastream/RTCDTMFSender.idl vs Source/modules/mediastream/RTCDTMFSender.h (duration)

* Source/modules/webdatabase/SQLResultSet.idl vs Source/modules/webdatabase/SQLResultSet.h (insertId)

Issue: Write client-side automated integration tests for policy to send Network Interface data to DMS
Issue description:
Note: This is finished. I'm entering task for reporting completeness.

Write automated integration tests for new/changed code written for the new Network Interface reporting feature, and in particular the ReportDeviceNetworkInterfaces device policy. Tests should be written as browsertests, if possible, so they can be run in BVT.

Automated test(s) are required during Go/NoGo reviwew, before the new feature will be approved for inclusion in a release.

Issue: sourceforge_url in DEPS file is old and causes problems vs using their new SVN server host URL
Issue description:
Concerning: 
"sourceforge_url": "http://%(repo)s.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/%(repo)s", 
line in the DEPS file which goes to https://jsoncpp.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/jsoncpp/ 

I am suggesting to update the SVN checkout URL from that old 1.6.9 SVN server to the new 1.7.7 SVN sourceforge server URL here: 
"sourceforge_url": "http://svn.code.sf.net/p/%(repo)s/code", 
which points to the new proper and official updated trunk http://svn.code.sf.net/p/jsoncpp/code/

Their reference checkout URL on the main code page: http://sourceforge.net/p/jsoncpp/code/268/tree/trunk/jsoncpp/ is also
"svn checkout http://svn.code.sf.net/p/jsoncpp/code/trunk jsoncpp-code"

Mainly I wasn't able to checkout my chromium source tree from the old URL earlier today for 2-3 hours because of that old server messing up and being inaccessible to me. 

Once I changed to the new URL everything went beautifully.

Also I have had to nuke that src/third_party/jsoncpp source directory unusually often, I believe it's from dev's having a mix/match of SVN entries coming from that old server or maybe the way sourceforge serves the wrong version of the SVN server during checkouts corrupting the .svn files forcing many nukes once a week or two.


Patch basically =
- "sourceforge_url": "http://%(repo)s.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/%(repo)s",
+ "sourceforge_url": "http://svn.code.sf.net/p/%(repo)s/code",

Issue: WEBPImageDecoder.cpp uses unreleased libwebp features
Issue description:
Here's what I get when trying to compile against libwebp-0.3.1:

../../third_party/WebKit/Source/core/platform/image-decoders/webp/WEBPImageDecoder.cpp: In member function bool WebCore::WEBPImageDecoder::updateDemuxer():
../../third_party/WebKit/Source/core/platform/image-decoders/webp/WEBPImageDecoder.cpp:248:69: error: WebPIterator has no member named blend_method
../../third_party/WebKit/Source/core/platform/image-decoders/webp/WEBPImageDecoder.cpp:248:85: error: WEBP_MUX_BLEND was not declared in this scope
../../third_party/WebKit/Source/core/platform/image-decoders/webp/WEBPImageDecoder.cpp:256:109: error: WebPIterator has no member named has_alpha

I think this was introduced in https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/22802020 as a cherry-pick from upstream git.

It's obviously fine to let this bake for a while in our repo, but ideally libwebp should make a release with this code before M31 hits stable.

It seems I can't assign it to Urvang, so trying Frank first - could you help route this to the right people?

Issue: CL 56883003 breaks all V8 standalone win and mac builders
Issue description:
The following commit https://codereview.chromium.org/56883003/ breaks the v8 builders on win and mac, see e.g. here: http://chromegw.corp.google.com/i/client.v8/builders/V8%20Mac/builds/7687

On the v8 waterfall we use the --build-dir flag. It might have something to do with making clobber work on the v8 directory layout. I'll investigate for a quick fix, otherwise there is no win and mac coverage on the v8 waterfall.

Issue: chrome does not pick up the right associate device when there are multiple associated devices.
Issue description:
Version: 
OS: Mac

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. use a mac station machine with a built-in device.
2. go to http://webrtc.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/samples/js/demos/html/local-audio-rendering.html
3. use the built-in device and start a call

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
You should hear audio.
But no sound.

The problem is that when a device has multiple associated devices, we simply pick up the first one, this will lead to no audio when the device has no speaker or headset pluggin.

Issue: Assertion hit in EventSource::abortConnectionAttempt()
Issue description:
We hit the following assertion in EventSource::abortConnectionAttempt() under certain circumstances:
STDERR: ASSERTION FAILED: m_requestInFlight
STDERR: ../../third_party/WebKit/Source/core/page/EventSource.cpp(309) : void WebCore::EventSource::abortConnectionAttempt()
STDERR: Received signal 11 SEGV_MAPERR 0000bbadbeef
STDERR: [0x000000685010] base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace()
STDERR: [0x0000006848f5] base::debug::(anonymous namespace)::StackDumpSignalHandler()
STDERR: [0x7f3b879f4bd0] <unknown>
STDERR: [0x00000489aadf] WebCore::EventSource::abortConnectionAttempt()
STDERR: [0x00000489aa0a] WebCore::EventSource::didFailAccessControlCheck()
STDERR: [0x00000199f4c0] WebCore::DocumentThreadableLoader::makeSimpleCrossOriginAccessRequest()
STDERR: [0x00000199f1c1] WebCore::DocumentThreadableLoader::makeCrossOriginAccessRequest()
STDERR: [0x00000199f054] WebCore::DocumentThreadableLoader::DocumentThreadableLoader()
STDERR: [0x00000199ebf6] WebCore::DocumentThreadableLoader::create()
STDERR: [0x000001c671bd] WebCore::ThreadableLoader::create()
STDERR: [0x000004899e25] WebCore::EventSource::connect()
STDERR: [0x00000489983d] WebCore::EventSource::create()
STDERR: [0x00000224d2ed] WebCore::EventSourceV8Internal::constructor()
STDERR: [0x00000224d6bc] WebCore::V8EventSource::constructorCallback()
STDERR: [0x00000153527f] v8::internal::FunctionCallbackArguments::Call()
STDERR: [0x0000010e50ac] v8::internal::Builtin_HandleApiCallConstruct()
STDERR: [0x359fe240824e] <unknown>

This happens when attempting a cross-origin request towards a non-HTTP URL, an early verification of the protocol scheme will cause didFailAccessControlCheck to be called synchronously before the loader has even finished being created. This special case was not handled properly, since we tried to cancel a non-existing loader, which resulted in a crash.

This issue was fixed a while back in WebKit but never cherry-picked to Blink:
http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/149098

Issue: Specify direction for all calls to constructTextRun and Font::width
Issue description:
Follow up to issue 327465 where text direction was made an explicit argument to constructTextRun and Font::width.

We still have a number of call sites where the direction is not specified, this bug tracks updating those.

Issue: Master bug to track regressions caused by invoking cursor-hiding logic on touch in Desktop Aura
Issue description:
The blocking issues are regressions in M34 caused by r240976 (for which r240827 was landed as a prerequisite change). These patches have been reverted from M33 (see issue 332477).

ananta@ and I are looking at addressing some of the root causes for the blocking issues, but if these cannot be resolved then we should consider reverting r240976 and r240827 from M34 and re-thinking our approach.

Issue: Web IDL: support ByteString
Issue description:
If I try to use ByteString in an idl file, the bindings generator complains with:

Could NOT find IDL file for interface "ByteString"

Some specs use ByteString like:
- XMLHeaderRequest.setRequestHeader
- Response (defined in ServiceWorker)

Without IDL support, we must manually convert from a DOMString, as seen in:
https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/23983021

See also:
http://heycam.github.io/webidl/#es-ByteString
https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=319694

I'm not sure it's better to support ByteString in Blink IDL or to just do it manually. This bug is partly just to document the issue.

Example URL:
http://jsfiddle.net/YsJP3/show

Steps to reproduce the problem:
Check this: http://jsfiddle.net/YsJP3/

You can note that accents are cutted off on Chrome, Safari and Opera. Seems a Webkit issue (am I on right place?). Firefox it works perfecly. (IE it works too, but don't tell to it!) 

Check attached images.

Font that I used for it is "Droid Sans" from Google Fonts. Even when I set to a high pixel it cut off some accents pixels.

What is the expected behavior?
Show accents correctly.

What went wrong?
-

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 34.0.1847.45 Channel: beta
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 13.0 r0

Issue: [multi-profiles] PerformanceMonitorUncleanExitBrowserTest is failing
Issue description:
PerformanceMonitorUncleanExitBrowserTest.OneProfileUncleanExit
PerformanceMonitorUncleanExitBrowserTest.TwoProfileUncleanExit

are failing when multi-profiles are enabled by default.

In order to enable multi-profiles by default this test has to be fixed.

For now while multi-profiles is not enabled by default please consider fixing test and also adding parameter that will pass --multi-profiles flag.

Example: 
https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/chrome/browser/chromeos/login/existing_user_controller_browsertest.cc&q=kMultiprofiles%20file:test&sq=package:chromium&type=cs&l=131

IN_PROC_BROWSER_TEST_P(ExistingUserControllerPublicSessionTest, ...)

IN_PROC_BROWSER_TEST_P instead of IN_PROC_BROWSER_TEST_F is used.

INSTANTIATE_TEST_CASE_P(ExistingUserControllerTestInstantiation,
ExistingUserControllerTest,
testing::Bool());

INSTANTIATE_TEST_CASE_P(ExistingUserControllerPublicSessionTestInstantiation,
ExistingUserControllerPublicSessionTest,
testing::Bool());

Issue: HTMLDetailsElement should fire a toggle event
Issue description:
http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/interactive-elements.html#the-details-element

When the open attribute changes we should fire an async event called toggle.

Issue: Align HTMLSrcsetParser with recent spec changes
Issue description:
Spec changes in http://picture.responsiveimages.org/#parse-srcset-attr were made for better future-compat (and bug fixes).

this is a meta bug to track implementation of these changes.

Issue: Signing out of managed accounts wipes the profile data before signing out
Issue description:
All browsing data must be deleted when signing out of a managed account.

Currently this wipe is done before signing out the Profile, but that has the issue of wiping the user's bookmarks and there's a chance that sync will send this update to the server.

The code should be fixed to sign the user out first, and then wipe the data.

Issue: Regression: Spurious double click event when dismissing context menu.
Issue description:
Version 36.0.1985.84 beta
Platform 5841.45.0 (Official Build) beta-channel link
Firmware Google_Link.2695.1.133

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Open a web page
2. Right click (opening the context menu)
3. Left click (in the same spot, or anywhere else)

Expected: The menu is dismissed, and a sequence of [mousedown, mouseup, click] events is fired.

Actual: A dblclick event happens. Namely, the menu is dismissed, and a sequence of [mousedown, mouseup, click, dblclick] events is fired. (This is visible by the text on the page being selected.)

http://quirksmode.org/js/events_mouse.html#link1

Issue: Convert linux_asan builder to recipes.

Master: tryserver.chromium.linux
Builder: linux_asan

Conversion to recipes is a prerequisite to running this bot on Swarming, to meet cycle time of <1 hour.

Issue: Code Review: Revert sometimes doesn't add TBR line
Issue description:
Creating a revert from Rietveld should automatically TBR the patch author, especially if I check the "CQ this now" box.

In particular, I used the "Revert Patchset" button on this CL:
https://codereview.chromium.org/382543003/
which created this revert:
https://codereview.chromium.org/451633004/

But the autogenerated description did not include a TBR= line, so the CQ summarily threw it out complaining that there was no LGTM.

It would be nice if these reverts included at least a TBR line; there's a case to be made that perhaps they ought to be NOTRY and/or NOTREECHECKS as well.

Example URL:
http://jsfiddle.net/KVQTd/2/

Steps to reproduce the problem:

2) Click "remove content"

What is the expected behavior?
the entire flexbox should resize according to its content

What went wrong?
The flexbox stays at the enlarged size

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No

Does this work in other browsers? Yes

OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 14.0 r0

See https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=369869 for a related issue but this is concerned with the children being flex parents themselves and the use of flex-directino:column

Issue: Regression: Chrome turns black & dysfunctional on hitting "Alt+Enter" in Google Spreadsheet in Chrome OS mode.
Issue description:
Chrome Version: 39.0.2171.11 (Official Build)f3ba9d8559804bd65d6c6e8304ba60d5850cfdcb-refs/branch-heads/2171@{#48} - 32/64-bit.
OS: Windows 7 (Aero enabled)

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Launch chrome, navigate and sign in to "Google Drive", Create a new spreadsheet
2. Click on any cell in the sheet and enter some contents in the cell
3. Now double click on the cell again and press "Alt+Enter" to add spaces below or above the content and observe

Browser turns black on pressing "Alt+Enter" keys in Chrome OS mode. Again hitting "Alt+Enter" makes the browser and spreadsheet unstable.

Hitting "Alt+Enter" keys within the cells in Google spreadsheets should add spaces.

This is an Chrome OS mode specific regression issue, broken in M-39 series.
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/54efb2353d1a90840fcfad2ca5b5b3a8c7883154..93727f756a29c617d0f321386e09bf8a89eefc96?pretty=fuller&n=14

Suspecting - r292464

Note: This works fine in Win 7 - Desktop mode and in Windows 8 mode for Win 8 OS.

Issue: [ServiceWorkerCache] Put() should block other cache functions
Issue description: The ServiceWorkerCache can't handle concurrent serviceworkers reading and writing to the same key. Writing needs to block reading. There is only one function that can write (Put, Add maps to Put), so when putting the cache needs to queue up other operations on that key and then run them all once the put is complete.

Issue: [Resources] Change the number of storable rendered frame images with memory pressure
Issue description:
At the moment the |RendererFrameManager| determines a number of cached rendered (but hidden) tabs from the amount of memory available at system start.

It should listen to the |MemoryPressureListener| and release any buffers stored above the calculated limit. Upon re-allocation it should then use |MemoryPressureObserverChromeOS::GetCurrentPressureLevel| to change the amount of renderer frames dependent on the memory pressure:

As such we might want to use:
MEMORY_PRESSURE_LEVEL_LOW - 100/100
MEMORY_PRESSURE_LEVEL_MODERATE - 60/100
MEMORY_PRESSURE_LEVEL_HIGH - 30/100
MEMORY_PRESSURE_LEVEL_CRITICAL - 20/100

See go/chromeosresourcepressure for more information.

Note: This plan might get a bit cleaner if the MemoryPressureListener would change as proposed in issue 782053002.

Issue: Regression: Image on WebGL experiments flickers on clicking 'copy image' context menu.
Issue description:
Chrome Version: 41.0.2264.2 (Official Build) Revision 31a62c588097b030399cba0ee4ffc99fd05f8b15-refs/branch-heads/2264@{#2} 32/64 bit
OS: Windows (Win 7: Aero enabled), Mac
URL: https://www.khronos.org/registry/webgl/sdk/demos/google/san-angeles/index.html

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Launch Chrome and go to above URL. (or open any WebGL experiment containing images)
2. Right click on the image and select 'Copy image' context menu, observe.

Image content flickers after selecting copy image context option.

Image content should not flicker when copy image context menu is selected.

This is a regression issue broken in M-41 and will soon update other info.

Issue: Change from AnimatableStrokeDasharrayList to SVGStrokeDasharrayStyleInterpolation
Issue description: The property stroke-dasharray should be animated using a new class, SVGStrokeDasharrayStyleInterpolation, instead of using animatable values.

Issue: Improve ImageFrameGenerator YUV image decoding dectection
Issue description:
YUV decoding is enabled in M41 (and is on for desktop by defualt, therefore?), or when ganeshed forced (--force-gpu-rasterization), it seems Blink is now creating PNGImageDecoders, WEBPImageDecoders, and so on and then doing an image header decode just to ask them if they support YUV decoding.

This happens in the impl-side-paint flow in ImageFrameGenerator.cpp I believe.

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/third_party/WebKit/Source/platform/graphics/ImageFrameGenerator.cpp&q=Source/platform/graphics/ImageFrameGenerator.cpp&sq=package:chromium&l=174

Issue description: See the link to graphs below.

Issue: SVG No and False Redraw - When multiple inline fragments are modified concurrently
Issue description:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.94 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
http://jsbin.com/nodeyesito/1/

Steps to reproduce the problem:
NOTE: The attached file and url show the problem reduced as abstractly as possible, however this bug still appears to be dependant on quite a few conditions. I will describe only the most important ones conceptually below:

1. Create two inline SVG fragments within a page, each with at least one shape. Create them in the same structure and with the same CSS properties shown in the example file (they are all necessary except specific sizes and duration etc).

2. Trigger a CSS transition of the grandparent of one of the SVG fragments by changing it's top and left style properties.

3. During the CSS transition and within a single stack frame: modify a shape in both SVG fragments in any way using JavaScript element.setAttribute API. (shapes within two or more SVG fragments must be modified to reproduce this bug).

What is the expected behavior?
When the shapes are modified during the CSS transition, they should be redrawn and the CSS transition should continue uninterrupted.

What went wrong?
The shapes are not redrawn and the CSS transition is interrupted leaving the target element in place at the time the shapes were modified.

The position of the shape can be triggered to correctly redraw by modifying the shape in any way again, however the shape geometry is still not updated and the CSS overflow clipping mask position is not updated and any remaining CSS transition will not continue (only a single frame is partially rendered).

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? Yes This definitely worked on 2014-10-27 in google chrome stable and chromium stable

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.94 Channel: stable
OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

The abstract example use case might seem a little unusual, this was derived from a more complex layout where inline span elements are used up the tree for styling and the targets are actually drag n drop elements containing animated svg content (shapes with changing geometry). This is affecting a group of products using this structure.

The attached file / jsbin example contain the problem as reduced as much as possible, all elements and CSS properties are required. The Javascript is accompanied by more detailed comments.

Issue: Make clang tot bots upload crash logs somewhere automatically
Issue description:
The clang tot bots are great at finding regressions. But right now, it's a bit annoying to file LLVM bugs for regressions since one either has to repro a problem locally or ssh to the bot (through 3 hops, entering multiple passwords) to grab crash logs.

It'd be nice if some step would look at the compile output and automatically upload crash logs tosomewhere.

The "look at compile output" tech could then also be used to do 338759 for desktop (and for android on recipes).

Issue: Page info "Site information" section should animate in when ready
Issue description:
As it stands, the "Site information" section appears with a delay. Ultimately, it would be nice to animate it in with the rest of the view's content and not resize the containing modal. Is this possible?

If this is not, and its appearance must remain async, we should coordinate an entrance animation for this content. Off the top of my head, I would suggest something like this (I will flush out the timing if we have to go this route):

1) Animate the containing modal's height with the "fast-out-slow-in" timing function: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0.0, 0.2, 1) over x milliseconds
2) After x delay, animate the site info section with the same timing/easing specs as the other content

OS Version: 6.3

What steps will reproduce the problem?
Open data:text/html,<style>@keyframes spin { 0% { transform-origin: center center; transform: rotate(0); } 100% { transform-origin: center center; transform: rotate(180deg); } } .spinner { animation: spin 1s infinite; background: blue; width: 10px; height: 10px; }</style><div class="spinner" />

Compare it with data:text/html,<style>@keyframes spin { 0% { transform-origin: 50% 50%; transform: rotate(0); } 100% { transform-origin: 50% 50%; transform: rotate(180deg); } } .spinner { animation: spin 1s infinite; background: blue; width: 10px; height: 10px; }</style><div class="spinner" />

Issue: window.performance.navigation.redirectCount counts all redirects if last redirect wasn't cross origin
Issue description:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/600.4.10 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/8.0.4 Safari/600.4.10

Example URL:

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Create a chain of 2 redirects: origin1 -> origin2 -> origin2, so that the origins are the same in the last redirect.
2. Inspect window.performance.navigation.{redirectCount, redirectStart, redirectEnd, redirectTime}

What is the expected behavior?
According to the spec:
"redirectCount attribute
This attribute must return the number of redirects since the last non-redirect navigation under the current browsing context. If there is no redirect or there is any redirect that is not from the same origin as the destination document, this attribute must return zero."
The same holds for other redirect* attributes.
So window.performance.navigation.redirectCount should be 0.

What went wrong?
window.performance.navigation.redirectCount shows the actual redirectCount.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? No 

Does this work in other browsers? No Safari 8.0.4 (10600.4.10.7)

Chrome version: <Copy from: 'about:version'> Channel: dev
OS Version: OS X 10.10.2
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

The problem is that the flag that determines whether the redirect was cross-origin or not is updated on every redirect and not accumulated. I fixed this issue here: https://codereview.chromium.org/1128003002

Either way, we need to add the plumbing for getAvailability() to reject.

Issue: Scroll position is restored prematurely causing it to be incorrectly clamped
Issue description:
Version: M43+
OS: all

What steps will reproduce the problem?
0. Open devtools and emulate a mobile device (e.g., nexus 5)
1. Visit http://output.jsbin.com/zasipe/quiet
2. Scroll all the way to bottom
3. Got to a different page e.g., http://output.jsbin.com/kapogi 
4. Click back

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
scroll position should be restored as it was previously but it is not restored completely.

My investigation has identified a bug in clamp detection logic which is causing this. Essentially the logic no longer waits for frame loading to complete before deciding to clamp the scroll position. This means it restores prematurely and clamps the scroll position unnecessarily.

See: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/blink/+/8bc037e5fd4673a0e2c6528f061e9aed0b203d62%5E%21/Source/core/loader/FrameLoader.cpp

Issue: Merge fix for "Frozen video when switching capturers"
Issue description:
Request to merge https://codereview.webrtc.org/1345473002 into M46. Full details are available in https://code.google.com/p/webrtc/issues/detail?id=4994

Justification:
The fix addresses a regression in M46 Hangout functionality - when switching between video sources, such as going from video stream to screensharing, there is a very long delay before content from the new video source is visible to the other participant.

Sample repro steps:
1) Join a 2 party hangout. Call the participants UserA and UserB.
2) Have UserA stream normal video to UserB for a minute or more.
3) Have UserA then start screensharing (desktop or window, doesn't matter) to UserB

Without the fix - UserA's screenshare content can take a minute+ to appear to UserB. During this time, UserB either sees a black screen or the last rendered video frame from UserA.
With the fix - UserA's screenshare content appears very quickly (depending on network connection quality, as usual).

pbos@ and I have verified that this is fixed in today's Canary (47.0.2509.0)

Additional justification - the fix also includes a new unit test.

Issue: GN isn't propagating the data_deps of a group correctly, and isolates broke as a result
Issue description:
In bug 536192, we hit a fairly serious regression where the telemetry_gpu_tests started failling on the trybots because the isolate no longer included the chrome binary.

The isolate is supposed to include the chrome binary, because //chrome/test:telemetry_gpu_tests has a data_deps = [ ..., "//chrome" ] entry, and this was previously working.

It appears, however, that https://codereview.chromium.org/1364103002 changed the definition of //chrome from an executable() to a group(), and when that happened, GN dropped the runtime dependencies on the floor.

We worked around this in https://codereview.chromium.org/1369813003 so that we didn't have to revert thakis's change, but clearly we need to figure out if this is a real bug because I have no idea what else might be broken as a result of this.

Issue: QuotaDatabase transaction handling on schema upgrade is incorrect.
Issue description:
In case of old schema version, UpgradeSchema() is called before the long-running-transaction is opened. The implementation calls Commit(), but since there is no long-running transaction open, the first call hits a DCHECK at the top of Connection::CommitTransaction() in debug builds.

Since there was no transaction open, the earlier code was autocommit, so if the developer re-launches Chromium, they will not hit the upgrade the second time around.

In release builds, the call to Commit() will open a new transaction, and on return from EnsureDatabaseVersion() a BeginTransaction() is called - which will now be nested, so Commit() calls in the same Chrome run as a schema upgrade will never be committed to disk.

Also, in release builds the schema upgrade will not be atomic, so any table changes may be made while the version number may not be changed. So there may be databases in the wild with meta.version less than the actual schema version. I'm not sure how this is best addressed, but it has potential to have left some number of databases in a weird state.

I was going to propose this fix:
https://codereview.chromium.org/1429463003
but it makes QuotaDatabaseTest.UpgradeSchema flakey. I think it's because SetHostQuota() calls ScheduleCommit(). I considered moving the BeginTransaction() call above EnsureDatabaseVersion(), but CreateSchema() is clearly written to be executed outside the long-running transaction.

The best I could think of was BeginTransaction() above EnsureDatabaseVersion(), when Commit() after. This seems like gross overkill, so I figure I should defer to the code owners.

To kinuko@ because of comment in CreateSchema(). Pri-1 because it's possibly leaving things in a persistent inconsistent state. M-48 because of Pri-1, but it seems likely M-47 might be a better goal.

Issue: Take in account existing calibration when running calibratiion
Issue description:
Using the newer cros ec IIO driver stack, and EC code, EC, outputs the raw values wiht calibscale and calibbias already applied.

When calibration code run, it must take in account the variable before updating the vpd. 
For accelerometer and gyro, we were luck that by default the EC does do any calibration, so bias was 0.
However, for the SI114x light and proximity sensor, the EC needs to offset the value (256 == 0 Lux). The calculated interest does not yet take in account that offest. 

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/#/c/286282/15

We can address the issue by reading calibbias/calibscale, and adding/multipliying these values to the calculated calibration before writing the final values in the vpd.

Issue: Chrome fails on conformance2/textures/misc/tex-unpack-params.html with nVidia graphics card
Issue description:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
(1) open chrome with command line: --enable-unsafe-es3-apis
(2) go to Open https://www.khronos.org/registry/webgl/sdk/tests/conformance2/textures/misc/tex-unpack-params.html?webglVersion=2


What is the expected result?
All tests should pass.

What happens instead?
Some unpack buffer tests failed.

My graphics card is GeForce GTX 750 (driver version:349.16), OS is ArchLinux.

After investigating, I found this bug should be a nVidia driver bug. This test case passed on ChromeOS. 
The root cause is that driver doesn't handle last row of unpack buffer well. Driver assumes only UNPACK_ROW_LENGTH pixels for last row. So, (width - UNPACK_ROW_LENGTH ) pixels are missing for the last row of a texture, (width - 2*UNPACK_ROW_LENGTH) pixels are missing for the last second row, and etc. It's not easy to workaround in command buffer.

Issue: Invalid JavaScript in event handler content attributes get the value undefined instead of null
Issue description:
This is the first part of issue 597900 for why this test is failing: http://w3c-test.org/html/webappapis/scripting/events/invalid-uncompiled-raw-handler-compiled-once.html

Simple test page here: http://output.jsbin.com/qigeto

Spec: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/webappapis.html#event-handler-content-attributes, https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/webappapis.html#internal-raw-uncompiled-handler

In particular: "If body is not parsable as FunctionBody or if parsing detects an early error, then follow these substeps: ... Set H's value to null."

Browsers tested:
Chrome 52.0.2739.0 Linux: fail
Firefox 46.0 Linux: pass
Safari 9.1 Mac: pass
Edge 13.10586 Win10: pass
IE 11 Win10: pass

Probably minor (not aware of any affected site) but given EVERY other browser gets this right I'd call this Hotlist-Interop. Perhaps the fix is trivial and we can just make it?

Issue: Transform animations on elements don't get composited
Issue description:
Test: https://jsfiddle.net/ups4x5sk/

Most likely regressed in:
https://codereview.chromium.org/1423893002

This bug is due to an inconsistency between layout's and animation's idea of what can and cannot be transformed. The logic in layout should be exposed to animations e.g. layoutObject()->canTransform() to avoid such mismatches.

Issue: loman: rewrite manifest loading logic to use lib.git.Manifest (to support <include>)
Issue description:
I updated depot tool, create a new minilayout repo:

When I workon start a new package, repo is not asking to sync.
repo sync does not extract the new package code.

Created a directory:
gwendal/cave_firmware/
Repo init with:
repo init \
-u https://chrome-internal.googlesource.com/chromeos/manifest-internal.git \
--repo-url='https://chromium.googlesource.com/external/repo.git' \
-g minilayout -b firmware-glados-7820.B

Set went fine, installing base packages, but it would not set up new packages:
cros_workon start --board cave sys-boot/depthcharge
10:11:55: INFO: Started working on 'sys-boot/depthcharge' for 'cave'


Log in older minilayout repo, the expected behavior works:
Compare a samus repo:
cros_workon start --board samus chromeos-base/autotest-tests-cryptohome
WARNING: 'portageq envvar PORTDIR_OVERLAY' is deprecated. Use 'portageq repositories_configuration' instead.
Please run "repo sync" now.
INFO : Started working on 'chromeos-base/autotest-tests-cryptohome' for 'samus'

With newer one:
cros_workon start --board cave chromeos-base/autotest-tests-cryptohome
Usage: loman add [options] <name> <--workon | <path> --remote <remote> >

loman: error: No project named 'chromiumos/third_party/autotest' in the default manifest.
cros_workon: Unhandled exception:
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/mnt/host/source/chromite/bin/cros_workon", line 164, in <module>
commandline.ScriptWrapperMain(FindTarget)
File "/mnt/host/source/chromite/lib/commandline.py", line 834, in ScriptWrapperMain
ret = target(argv[1:])
File "/mnt/host/source/chromite/scripts/cros_workon.py", line 89, in main
use_workon_only=options.workon_only)
File "/mnt/host/source/chromite/lib/workon_helper.py", line 562, in StartWorkingOnPackages
self._AddProjectsToPartialManifests(new_atoms)
File "/mnt/host/source/chromite/lib/workon_helper.py", line 494, in _AddProjectsToPartialManifests
cros_build_lib.RunCommand(cmd, print_cmd=False)
File "/mnt/host/source/chromite/lib/cros_build_lib.py", line 619, in RunCommand
raise RunCommandError(msg, cmd_result)
chromite.lib.cros_build_lib.RunCommandError: return code: 2; command: loman add --workon chromiumos/third_party/autotest
cwd=None

BTW, in loman.py, I can see some code like "active_manifest == 'minilayout.xml'"
But none of my minilayout repo uses minilayout.xml. I can not even find this file.

Calling the loman command manually:
loman add --workon chromiumos/platform/ec
Usage: loman add [options] <name> <--workon | <path> --remote <remote> >

loman: error: No project named 'chromiumos/platform/ec' in the default manifest.

Although it is in .repo/manifests/external_full.xml, included by .repo/manifest.xml.
Interestingly, the manifest.xml file for cave minilayout is different from the samus minilayout, where .repo/manifest.xml there is more complete.

Issue: Add smoketest to ensure swarming named caches are persistent
Issue description:
AI:
Modify luci-py/appengine/swarming/local_smoke_test.py to add a new test case that shall do:

- trigger a task that requests a named cache and put something in there
- trigger a second task and ensure the cache is still populated.
- update tools/stat_bot.py wipe_cache() to wipe any named cache.

Issue: ExecLinkWrapper buffers all output, fails if it gets too large
Issue description:
While doing verbose linking of a full LTCG build of chrome.dll, using these settings:

is_chrome_branded = true
is_component_build = false
is_debug = false
target_cpu = "x86"
is_official_build = true
full_wpo_on_official = true

the linker produces roughly 1.1 GB of output. When ExecLinkWrapper in tool_wrapper.py processes this output it uses communicate() which grabs it as one huge chunk. It then splits it into lines which doubles the memory footprint to a minimum of 2.2 GB. Since the depot_tools version of python is 32-bit (and is not large-address-aware) this necessarily causes an out-of-memory failure in the Python script, and all of the output (which takes an hour to generate) is lost.

We either need to switch to 64-bit Python or we need to process the output one line at a time. Changing Python to be large-address-aware might work but does not give a lot of breathing room.

Issue: Access-Control-Request-Headers has header names separated by comma+space, but should be separated by comma only (no space)
Issue description:
Chrome Version : 57.0.2946.0 Revision 883e7b724370402ca8709a69ccec538e04f0bc2b-refs/heads/master@{#437239}
URLs : https://github.com/w3c/web-platform-tests/blob/master/fetch/api/cors/cors-preflight.html http://web-platform.test:8000/fetch/api/cors/cors-preflight.html
Other browsers tested:
Add OK or FAIL, along with the version, after other browsers where you
have tested this issue:
Safari: OK (WebKit Nightly)
Firefox: OK
IE: Fail [no fetch() support]

What steps will reproduce the problem?
(1) Run https://github.com/w3c/web-platform-tests/blob/master/fetch/api/cors/cors-preflight.html in a browser (e.g., from http://web-platform.test:8000/fetch/api/cors/cors-preflight.html, if you have a local web-platform-tests environment set up)
(2) Notice failures for assert_equals: Access-Control-Allow-Headers value expected  but got 

What is the expected result?
Expected no failures.


What happens instead?
Got failures for assert_equals: Access-Control-Allow-Headers value expected  but got 

Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if
possible.

The failures are because the expected result is a list of header names separated only be "," (comma), but Blink instead returns a list of header names separate by ", " (comma+space).

Issue: BrowserThreadImpl::StartWithOptions blocks until the underlying thread starts
Issue description:
Blocking on Thread::Start() was fixed by kinuko@ in r331235.

But looks like it regressed in r408295.

The issue is the call to GetThreadId() which is blocking under the hood.

This appears unintentional as r408295 also introduced BrowserThreadImpl::StartAndWaitForTesting() which is redundant given the normal start also blocks...

I plan to address this as part of https://codereview.chromium.org/2464233002.

Issue: latest clang asserts on internal iOS bots
Issue description:
e.g. https://uberchromegw.corp.google.com/i/internal.bling.main/builders/trunk-autoroller/builds/6970/steps/compile/logs/stdio

Filed https://llvm.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=31374 , delta'ing a reduction atm.

The background here is that the clang roll before that broke tests on these bots (bug 673495) and I said that we could revert that time, but I wouldn't revert next time due to this having 0 bot coverage on the tot waterfall. We then fixed that miscompile, rolled forward, and that immediately triggered the next breakage on internal ios bots. Bug 673621 covers getting at least somewhat better test coverage.

I'll try to get a repro, revert the bad clang change, and roll forward, but the next next time I won't do that either unless there are tot bots.

Issue: seccomp failures should trigger a coredump for crash reporting
Issue description: Also setup post-launch monitoring of crashes.

Issue: blink: Don't call std::isfinite(double) then cast to float
Issue description:
Consider the following code in blink::BaseRenderingContext2D::drawImage

void BaseRenderingContext2D::drawImage(ExecutionContext* executionContext,
CanvasImageSource* imageSource,
double sx,
double sy,
double sw,
double sh,
double dx,
double dy,
double dw,
double dh,
ExceptionState& exceptionState) {
...
if (!std::isfinite(dx) || !std::isfinite(dy) || !std::isfinite(dw) ||
!std::isfinite(dh) || !std::isfinite(sx) || !std::isfinite(sy) ||
!std::isfinite(sw) || !std::isfinite(sh) || !dw || !dh || !sw || !sh)
return;
...
FloatRect srcRect = normalizeRect(FloatRect(sx, sy, sw, sh));

The std::isfinite calls aren't particularly helpful, since it's for a double, and we're using the result as a float.

This came up because issue 675123 was misattributed to me. Mass-replacing with "IsFiniteFloat" fixes that instance (a la https://codereview.chromium.org/2595973002/), but there are ~90 bugs all hitting the same issue, so a one-off fix isn't the way to go.

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?can=2&q=%22Float-cast-overflow%22&x=m&y=releaseblock&cells=ids

Issue: Wrong encoding detection for chart.fisco.co.jp
Issue description:
Chrome Version: 55+
OS: All

Reported in Japanese help forum:
https://productforums.google.com/forum/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer#!msg/chrome-ja/IOEIO92rnRI/Obyc7HnRCQAJ

What steps will reproduce the problem?
(1) Open http://chart.fisco.co.jp/fisco/cgi-bin/index.cgi
(2) Observe

What is the expected result?
Readable Japanese text. The page should be decoded as "EUC-JP".

What happens instead?
Garbled text. The page is decoded as "GBK".

Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

This is not a regression. However users can't choose the correct encoding due to the removal of encoding menu.

I confirmed this can be resolved by passing the URL as |url_hint| parameter or passing JAPANESE as |language_hint| parameter to CompactEncDet::DetectEncoding().

Issue: Recipes should mock out CPU count
Issue description: https://fuchsia-review.googlesource.com/c/18924/2/infra/recipes/fuchsia.py#108 is the motivation. We should allow mocking out of CPU count, so that simulation testing doesn't break on machines which have variable CPU counts.

Issue: Sign-in Error Chrome OS could not sync your data because your account sign-in details are out of date.
Issue description:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; CrOS x86_64 8872.76.0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/55.0.2883.105 Safari/537.36
Platform: Platform 8872.76.0 (Official Build) stable-channel peppy

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1a. <nothing> logs show no recent password changes, just reboots Chromebook to apply update or other reason. Go to What went wrong.
1b. To reproduce reliably: User changes Active Directory Password
2. Password is synced to Google through Google Apps Password Sync
3. User is unable to log into Chromebook. Often prompted to sign out and back in again if already signed in. User is never able to sign in until device is cleared.

see
https://productforums.google.com/forum/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer#!msg/chromebook-central/RYPe8uqRNUM/DHgu0aG1AwAJ

What is the expected behavior?
User signs into Chromebook. May be asked to provide old password to decrypt local data.

What went wrong?
Orange exclamation point shown by username on login. If user logs in, screen goes black and immediately logs back out. Wiping device data or powerwashing is only way to log user back in.

Did this work before? Yes Unsure. Problems began last spring

Chrome version: 55.0.2883.105 Channel: stable
OS Version: 8872.76.0
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 24.0 r0

Issue: Skipping analyze can cause us to miss bugs in analyze
Issue description:
This was caused by a bad change landing on the waterfall in 

https://codereview.chromium.org/2627093009

it was reverted in

https://codereview.chromium.org/2648383002

It looks like the problematic CL was missing an entry in gn_isolate_map.pyl, which caused analyze to fail. 

However, because we changed //testing/buildbot/*.json, the recipe's whitelist of "changes we can't analyze" (//testing/buildbot/trybot_analyze_config.json) matched, and so we skipped analyze and didn't detect the bug.

I think we need to change things so that we call analyze unconditionally and fail the build if analyze fails, but if analyze succeeds, *then* check the whitelist and ignore analyze's results. This should be a simple enough change.

In addition, we should work to make sure that the whitelist is as small as possible.

See crbug.com/684060 for the bug that motivated this one :).

Issue: Response('hello').body is an empty stream
Issue description:
new Response('hello').body.getReader().read().then(({v, done}) => console.log(done))

should print false, but actually prints true.

Issue: need a way to get to cdb.exe in isolated script test
Issue description:
I'd like to get to cdb.exe to symbolize crash dumps. It's part of the win_sdk that depot_tools maintains.

cc'ing tansell and dpranke as layout tests also need it, so I guess they might already have a way to get to it?

Since ODRHash is on the stack, I'm guessing:

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r299989 | rtrieu | 2017-04-11 14:31:00 -0700 (Tue, 11 Apr 2017) | 9 lines

[ODRHash] Improve handling of hash values

Calculating the hash in Sema::ActOnTagFinishDefinition could happen before
all sub-Decls were parsed or processed, which would produce the wrong hash
value. Change to calculating the hash on the first use and storing the value
instead. Also, avoid using the macros that were only for Boolean fields and
use an explicit checker during the DefintionData merge. No functional change,
but was this blocking other ODRHash patches.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

or

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r300001 | rtrieu | 2017-04-11 15:32:03 -0700 (Tue, 11 Apr 2017) | 11 lines

Revert r298824 & r298816, recommit r298742 & r298754

r299989 fixes the underlying issue by waiting long enough to late parsed
arguments to be processed before doing an calculating the hash.

r298742
[ODRHash] Add error messages for mismatched parameters in methods.

r298754
[ODRHash] Add support for array and decayed types.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Issue: Policy-set sign-in keyboards: Not all sign-in keyboards displayed for users without stored input method
Issue description:
Followup to bug 373324:

When the following conditions are met:
- The DeviceLoginScreenInputMethods policy is set,
- the device is on the sign-in screen,
- a user pod already exists on the sign-in screen,
- a user pod is focused on the sign-in screen and
- no last-used input method is stored for the user,

not all input methods set by the DeviceLoginScreenInputMethods policy are displayed.

Note that a special case of the conditions described above is the "user pod" for a public session - public sessions never have a last user input method stored for them.

Except for the special case of public session user pods, it should be very hard to trigger this bug, because in M59+, policy-enforced input methods are re-enforced when entering the "Add Person" dialog, which leads directly into a user session. After this user session exits, there will be a last used input method. 

Technical details:
- SigninScreenHandler::SetUserInputMethod fails to set a last-used input method.
- It falls back to calling InputMethodManagerImpl::StateImpl::SetInputMethodLoginDefault.
- As a consequence, InputMethodManagerImpl::StateImpl::EnableLoginLayouts is called
- This takes all predefined "login layouts" and filters them
- What should it do instead: It should always ensure that all policy-mandated login layouts are included.

Issue: Add type mapping for media::BitstreamBuffer and JpegDecodeAccelerator::Error
Issue description: Convert mojom::BitstreamBuffer to media::BitstreamBuffer and vice-versa using StructTraits. Similarly, add EnumTraits for JpegDecodeAccelerator::Error as well.

Issue: Web Share picker: Internationalize the format string
Issue description:
Chrome Version: 61
OS: Windows, Chrome OS, Linux

Currently TargetPickerTableModel::GetText in webshare_target_picker_view.cc hard-codes the format string "%s (%s)" when displaying the name and URL of a target.

This string should be internationalized so it can be translated for different locales.
